title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993". It pertains to the conveyance of vessels. The Secretary of Transportation may convey, without consideration, certain vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship. The Secretary of Transportation may convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials to merchant mariners. The organizations must sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused funds to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The vessels will be delivered at no cost to the Government in their current condition. The Secretary of Transportation can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating memorial ships. The vessels must be sold for scrap, with proceeds used to refurbish a memorial ship. Any unused funds must be returned to the United States. The vessels will be delivered at no cost to the Government in their current condition. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers, including EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, and MARINE STAR. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers include LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, and SHILOH. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers include LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, and SHILOH. Foreign-flag vessel H851 may engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from Texas to Viosca Knoll 989. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II, LINETTE, and M/V TWIN DRILL with specific endorsements, under certain conditions including major conversion in a US shipyard. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for the vessel REEL CLASS (Hawaii registration number HA-6566-E) with coastwise and fishery endorsements, despite certain regulations, if specific conditions are met including major conversion in a US shipyard. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with fishery endorsements for vessels DA WARRIOR and REEL CLASS, and allow the sale of vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC to non-US citizens. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
